text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Tuesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Opposition party, Parti pour le Progres et le Socialisme (PPS), adopts report calling for yes-vote in Sept 13 referendum on constitutional reform.
- Appeal court cuts to six months jail sentence imposed on 68-year-old French woman involved in drugs.
- United Nations Development Programme puts Morocco at 119th position for illiteracy.
- Survey commissioned by Youth Council and Directorate of Statistics says only few businesses provide staff with training.
- Dissident members distance themselves from their party, Organisation pour l'Action Democratique Populaire (OADP), which called for a no-vote in referendum.
- Moroccan Commission backing Iraqi people condemns American raid on Iraq.
